intro: Craspedolobium unijugum, commonly known as the single-lobed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. It is well adapted to arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
